intro: Mattia lanata var. punctata, commonly known as the velvety moss orchid, is a rare and striking epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant thrives in high humidity and indirect light, often growing on tree trunks or branches. Its unique appearance and ecological niche make it a sought-after specimen among orchid enthusiasts. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires careful conservation efforts.
